title:
Relative Entropy Method for Particle Approximation of the Landau
  Equation for Maxwellian Molecules
authors:
Jos\'e Antonio Carrillo, Xuanrui Feng, Shuchen Guo, Pierre-Emmanuel
  Jabin, Zhenfu Wang
abstract:
We derive the spatially homogeneous Landau equation for Maxwellian molecules
from a natural stochastic interacting particle system. More precisely, we
control the relative entropy between the joint law of the particle system and
the tensorized law of the Landau equation. To obtain this, we establish as key
tools the pointwise logarithmic gradient and Hessian estimates of the density
function and also a new Law of Large Numbers result for the particle system.
The logarithmic estimates are derived via the Bernstein method and the
parabolic maximum principle, while the Law of Large Numbers result comes from
crucial observations on the control of moments at the particle level.
